defs.docs: Generate JSON Schema documents from Rust code

defs.name: Map
defs.docs: The map type used by schemars types.

attributes.value: / The map type used by schemars types.
/ Currently a `BTreeMap` or `IndexMap` can be used, but this may change to a different implementation
/ with a similar interface in a future version of schemars.
/ The `IndexMap` will be used when the `preserve_order` feature flag is set.

defs.name: Set
defs.docs: The set type used by schemars types.

attributes.value: / The set type used by schemars types.
/ Currently a `BTreeSet`, but this may change to a different implementation
/ with a similar interface in a future version of schemars.

defs.name: MapEntry
defs.docs:
A view into a single entry in a map, which may either be vacant or occupied.
 This is constructed from the `entry` method on `BTreeMap` or `IndexMap`,
 depending on whether the `preserve_order` feature flag is set.

attributes.value: / A view into a single entry in a map, which may either be vacant or occupied.
/ This is constructed from the `entry` method on `BTreeMap` or `IndexMap`,
/ depending on whether the `preserve_order` feature flag is set.

defs.name: flatten
defs.docs: This function is only public for use by schemars_derive.

attributes.value: / This function is only public for use by schemars_derive.
/ It should not be considered part of the public API.

defs.name: _private
defs.docs:
This module is only public for use by `schemars_derive`. It should not need to be used by code
 outside of `schemars`, and should not be considered part of the public API.

attributes.value: / This module is only public for use by `schemars_derive`. It should not need to be used by code
/ outside of `schemars`, and should not be considered part of the public API.

fn json_schema_for_flatten<T>(&mut SchemaGenerator, bool) -> Schema where
T: ?Sized + JsonSchema

defs.name: gen
defs.docs: JSON Schema generator and settings.

attributes.value:
*
JSON Schema generator and settings.

This module is useful if you want more control over how the schema generated than the [`schema_for!`] macro gives you.
There are two main types in this module:two main types in this module:
* [`SchemaSettings`], which defines what JSON Schema features should be used when generating schemas (for example, how `Option`s should be represented).
* [`SchemaGenerator`], which manages the generation of a schema document.
*/

defs.name: SchemaSettings
defs.value: SchemaSettings { option_nullable, option_add_null_type, definitions_path, meta_schema, visitors, inline_subschemas }
defs.docs: Settings to customize how Schemas are generated.

attributes.value: / Settings to customize how Schemas are generated.

/ The default settings currently conform to [JSON Schema Draft 7](https://json-schema.org/specification-links.html#draft-7), but this is liable to change in a future version of Schemars if support for other JSON Schema versions is added.
/ If you require your generated schemas to conform to draft 7, consider using the [`draft07`](#method.draft07) method.

defs.name: option_nullable
defs.docs: If `true`, schemas for [`Option<T>`](Option) will include a `nullable` property.

attributes.value: / If `true`, schemas for [`Option<T>`](Option) will include a `nullable` property.
/ This is not part of the JSON Schema spec, but is used in Swagger/OpenAPI schemas.

defs.name: option_add_null_type
defs.docs: If `true`, schemas for [`Option<T>`](Option) will have `null` added to their [`type`](../schema/struct.SchemaObject.html#structfield.instance_type).

attributes.value: / If `true`, schemas for [`Option<T>`](Option) will have `null` added to their [`type`](../schema/struct.SchemaObject.html#structfield.instance_type).

defs.name: definitions_path
defs.docs: A JSON pointer to the expected location of referenceable subschemas within the resulting root schema.

attributes.value: / A JSON pointer to the expected location of referenceable subschemas within the resulting root schema.

defs.name: meta_schema
defs.docs: The URI of the meta-schema describing the structure of the generated schemas.

attributes.value: / The URI of the meta-schema describing the structure of the generated schemas.

defs.name: visitors
defs.docs: A list of visitors that get applied to all generated root schemas.

attributes.value: / A list of visitors that get applied to all generated root schemas.

defs.name: inline_subschemas
defs.docs: Inline all subschemas instead of using references.

attributes.value: / Inline all subschemas instead of using references.
/ Some references may still be generated in schemas for recursive types.

defs.name: subschema_for
defs.value: fn subschema_for<T>(&mut Self) -> Schema where T: ?Sized + JsonSchema
defs.docs: Generates a JSON Schema for the type `T`, and returns either the schema itself or a `$ref` schema referencing `T`'s schema.

attributes.value: / Generates a JSON Schema for the type `T`, and returns either the schema itself or a `$ref` schema referencing `T`'s schema.
/ If `T` is [referenceable](JsonSchema::is_referenceable), this will add `T`'s schema to this generator's definitions, and
/ return a `$ref` schema referencing that schema. Otherwise, this method behaves identically to [`JsonSchema::json_schema`].
/ If `T`'s schema depends on any [referenceable](JsonSchema::is_referenceable) schemas, then this method will
/ add them to the `SchemaGenerator`'s schema definitions.

defs.name: definitions
defs.docs: Borrows the collection of all [referenceable](JsonSchema::is_referenceable) schemas that have been generated.

attributes.value: / Borrows the collection of all [referenceable](JsonSchema::is_referenceable) schemas that have been generated.
/ The keys of the returned `Map` are the [schema names](JsonSchema::schema_name), and the values are the schemas

defs.name: definitions_mut
defs.docs: Mutably borrows the collection of all [referenceable](JsonSchema::is_referenceable) schemas that have been generated.

attributes.value: / Mutably borrows the collection of all [referenceable](JsonSchema::is_referenceable) schemas that have been generated.
/ The keys of the returned `Map` are the [schema names](JsonSchema::schema_name), and the values are the schemas

defs.name: take_definitions
defs.docs:
Returns the collection of all [referenceable](JsonSchema::is_referenceable) schemas that have been generated,
 leaving an empty map in its place.

attributes.value: / Returns the collection of all [referenceable](JsonSchema::is_referenceable) schemas that have been generated,

defs.name: root_schema_for_value
defs.value:
fn root_schema_for_value<T>(&mut Self, &T)
-> Result<RootSchema, serde_json::Error> where T: ?Sized + Serialize
defs.docs: Generates a root JSON Schema for the given example value.

attributes.value: / Generates a root JSON Schema for the given example value.
/ If the value implements [`JsonSchema`](crate::JsonSchema), then prefer using the [`root_schema_for()`](Self::root_schema_for())
/ function which will generally produce a more precise schema, particularly when the value contains any enums.

defs.name: into_root_schema_for_value
defs.value:
fn into_root_schema_for_value<T>(Self, &T)
-> Result<RootSchema, serde_json::Error> where T: ?Sized + Serialize
defs.docs: Consumes `self` and generates a root JSON Schema for the given example value.

attributes.value: / Consumes `self` and generates a root JSON Schema for the given example value.
/ If the value  implements [`JsonSchema`](crate::JsonSchema), then prefer using the [`into_root_schema_for()!`](Self::into_root_schema_for())
/ function which will generally produce a more precise schema, particularly when the value contains any enums.

defs.name: dereference
defs.docs: Attemps to find the schema that the given `schema` is referencing.

attributes.value: / Attemps to find the schema that the given `schema` is referencing.
/ If the given `schema` has a [`$ref`](../schema/struct.SchemaObject.html#structfield.reference) property which refers
/ to another schema in `self`'s schema definitions, the referenced schema will be returned. Otherwise, returns `None`.

defs.name: visit
defs.docs: Contains the [`Visitor`] trait, used to recursively modify a constructed schema and its subschemas.

defs.name: Visitor
defs.docs: Trait used to recursively modify a constructed schema and its subschemas.

attributes.value: / Trait used to recursively modify a constructed schema and its subschemas.

defs.name: visit_root_schema
defs.docs: Override this method to modify a [`RootSchema`] and (optionally) its subschemas.

attributes.value: / Override this method to modify a [`RootSchema`] and (optionally) its subschemas.
/ When overriding this method, you will usually want to call the [`visit_root_schema`] function to visit subschemas.

defs.name: visit_schema
defs.docs: Override this method to modify a [`Schema`] and (optionally) its subschemas.

attributes.value: / Override this method to modify a [`Schema`] and (optionally) its subschemas.
/ When overriding this method, you will usually want to call the [`visit_schema`] function to visit subschemas.

defs.docs: Override this method to modify a [`SchemaObject`] and (optionally) its subschemas.

attributes.value: / Override this method to modify a [`SchemaObject`] and (optionally) its subschemas.
/ When overriding this method, you will usually want to call the [`visit_schema_object`] function to visit subschemas.

defs.name: visit_root_schema
defs.value: fn visit_root_schema<V>(&mut V, &mut RootSchema) where V: Visitor + ?Sized
defs.docs: Visits all subschemas of the [`RootSchema`].

defs.name: visit_schema
defs.value: fn visit_schema<V>(&mut V, &mut Schema) where V: Visitor + ?Sized
defs.docs: Visits all subschemas of the [`Schema`].

defs.docs: Visits all subschemas of the [`SchemaObject`].

defs.name: ReplaceBoolSchemas
defs.docs: This visitor will replace all boolean JSON Schemas with equivalent object schemas.

attributes.value: / This visitor will replace all boolean JSON Schemas with equivalent object schemas.
/ This is useful for dialects of JSON Schema (e.g. OpenAPI 3.0) that do not support booleans as schemas.

defs.name: skip_additional_properties
defs.docs: When set to `true`, a schema's `additionalProperties` property will not be changed from a boolean.

attributes.value: / When set to `true`, a schema's `additionalProperties` property will not be changed from a boolean.

defs.name: RemoveRefSiblings
defs.docs: This visitor will restructure JSON Schema objects so that the `$ref` property will never appear alongside any other properties.

attributes.value: / This visitor will restructure JSON Schema objects so that the `$ref` property will never appear alongside any other properties.
/ This is useful for dialects of JSON Schema (e.g. Draft 7) that do not support other properties alongside `$ref`.

defs.name: SetSingleExample
defs.docs: This visitor will remove the `examples` schema property and (if present) set its first value as the `example` property.

attributes.value: / This visitor will remove the `examples` schema property and (if present) set its first value as the `example` property.
/ This is useful for dialects of JSON Schema (e.g. OpenAPI 3.0) that do not support the `examples` property.

defs.name: retain_examples
defs.docs: When set to `true`, the `examples` property will not be removed, but its first value will still be copied to `example`.

attributes.value: / When set to `true`, the `examples` property will not be removed, but its first value will still be copied to `example`.

defs.name: JsonSchema
defs.docs: A type which can be described as a JSON Schema document.

attributes.value: / A type which can be described as a JSON Schema document.
/ This is implemented for many Rust primitive and standard library types.
/ This can also be automatically derived on most custom types with `#[derive(JsonSchema)]`.

defs.name: is_referenceable
defs.docs: Whether JSON Schemas generated for this type should be re-used where possible using the `$ref` keyword.

attributes.value: / Whether JSON Schemas generated for this type should be re-used where possible using the `$ref` keyword.
/ For trivial types (such as primitives), this should return `false`. For more complex types, it should return `true`.
/ For recursive types, this **must** return `true` to prevent infinite cycles when generating schemas.

defs.name: schema_name
defs.docs: The name of the generated JSON Schema.

attributes.value: / The name of the generated JSON Schema.
/ This is used as the title for root schemas, and the key within the root's `definitions` property for subschemas.

defs.name: json_schema
defs.docs: Generates a JSON Schema for this type.

attributes.value: / Generates a JSON Schema for this type.
/ If the returned schema depends on any [referenceable](JsonSchema::is_referenceable) schemas, then this method will
/ add them to the [`SchemaGenerator`](gen::SchemaGenerator)'s schema definitions.
/ This should not return a `$ref` schema.
